Brain.FrontalLobe

Class Frontal

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Brain.FrontalLobe.Frontal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Frontal
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The class that represents all the Arrow objects into the screen for the game
    Author:
    reetmishra
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getRandomDirection

        public int getRandomDirection(int x)
        Returns random direction not including the current direction. If it returns 37, then the direction is left. If it returns 38, then the direction is up. If it returns 39, then the direction is down. If it returns 40, then the direction is down.
        Parameters:
        x - current direction of arrows
        Returns:
        random direction other than current direction

      • moveAcrossScreen

        public void moveAcrossScreen(int direction,
                             Arrow a)
        Moves all arrows across the screen in a certain direction
        Parameters:
        direction - direction to move arrows If it returns 37, then the direction is left. If it returns 38, then the direction is up. If it returns 39, then the direction is down. If it returns 40, then the direction is down.
        a - the arrow that needs to be moved

      • winGame

        public boolean winGame()
        Returns whether user won the game or not. To win, the number correct needs to be greater than the threshold in the time limit
        Returns:
        true if wins, and false if loses

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • changeOrientation

        public int changeOrientation()
        Changes orientation of arrows to a random orientation.
        Returns:
        integer representing new orientation of arrows If it returns 37, then the orientation is left. If it returns 38, then the orientation is up. If it returns 39, then the orientation is down. If it returns 40, then the orientation is down.

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect(java.awt.Color c,
                         int direction,
                         int pointingTo)
        Determines if the user pressed the correct key that corresponds to arrows based on the rules
        Parameters:
        c - the Color of the arrows
        direction - integer representing the direction of the arrows
        pointingTo - integer representing the orientation of the arrows
        Returns:
        true if user pressed correct key depending on arrows, false otherwise

      • changeImage

        public void changeImage()
        Randomly changes image of arrows (red, green, or blue)

      • getKeyHandler

        public Frontal.KeyHandler getKeyHandler()
        Returns keyHandler used
        Returns:
        KeyHandler used to check if the correct key is pressed

      • rotate

        public void rotate(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Arrow> arrows,
                   int currentPT,
                   int newPT)
        Rotates the arrows to a new orientation
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics used
        arrows - ArrayList of Arrow objects that need to be rotated
        currentPT - integer representing current orientation of arrows
        newPT - integer representing new orientation of arrows If it returns 37, then the orientation is left. If it returns 38, then the orientation is up. If it returns 39, then the orientation is down. If it returns 40, then the orientation is down.
